Description: Ostracon, fragment (three pieces joined) of the body of a red pottery vessel, interior very worn, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip and with remains of three lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying contents as year 10 wine of Aten domain.
Curator's comments: Part of 1922,1014.151-152 Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 1
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393172) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393172)
Condition: fair (worn and incomplete - three pieces joined)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Domain of Aten
